Name: RTX_Spend_2025
Description: RTX is reassessing its spend analytics capabilities due to inefficiencies with the current Accenture-built tool, which requires heavy manual reclassification and delays clean spend data until April/May. They are seeking an AI-driven, automated spend analytics solution with near 100% accuracy, harmonized taxonomy (UNSPSC-based), and strong cybersecurity compliance (ISO 27001, SOC 1/2, FedRAMP). Decision-making is led by the VP for non-product procurement, with high importance placed on aerospace and defense references (Lockheed, Boeing, Tata). The opportunity is to position Zycus as a proven partner offering AI-led classification, process efficiency, and secure data hosting tailored to defense sector standards.
Next_Step__c:
11/7/25 Cecil heard back from the Process team. VP for Non-Product Procurement & Logistics is fully aware of the situation, and he was the one to suggest to put things on hold until mid Q1. Scheduling reconnect for February.


10/14/25 Follow up email exchange with Cecil. No word back from Process Team review. Check back 10/30


9/29/25 Both Procurement leaders have been on vacation the past 2 weeks, one will be out until next week. Cecil asked for fcollow up on October 15th. Push for additional discovery.


9/23/25 Schedule follow up call with Cecil to discuss demo logistics and identify stakeholders

Customer_Business_Problem__c: RTX’s current Accenture-built spend analytics tool requires extensive manual reclassification, leading to delayed, inaccurate spend data and preventing procurement teams from focusing on strategic activities like renegotiation and contracting.

Primary Trigger: Campaign Engagement - 13 August 2025
Reasoning: The engagement with the specific campaign created initial contact and interest in Zycus, ultimately setting the stage for subsequent interactions, tasks, and eventual conversion. This early recognition paved the path to further discussions and solidified Zycus’s presence in the prospect's evaluation process.
Compelling_Event__c: RTX’s recent organizational realignment and UNSPSC-based taxonomy harmonization has created urgency to replace its inefficient spend analytics tool, as delayed and inaccurate data directly impacts procurement strategy and compliance in the aerospace and defense sector.
Is_there_a_Budget_related_discussion__c: The budget discussion related to this opportunity does not explicitly mention any specific amounts allocated or the approval status. However, it indicates that the next steps involve sharing detailed spend analytics materials and scheduling a demo after an internal review by RTX’s VP and process tools team. This suggests that budget considerations are likely tied to the outcomes of this review and the subsequent demo, but no specific timeline for funding decisions or constraints are outlined in the provided information. Decision-makers involved in budget approval include the VP and the process tools team, but further details on their roles in the budget approval process are not specified.
Deal_Acceleration_Summary__c:
Date: 09-09-2025

1. Opportunity History Summary (Latest & Actionable Insights)

  • RTX is undergoing a procurement transformation following a major organizational realignment and UNSPSC-based taxonomy harmonization, creating urgency to replace their current spend analytics tool.
  • The existing Accenture-built solution is manual, error-prone, and delays strategic procurement activities, posing compliance and cost risks.
  • Zycus has been shortlisted for evaluation; Cecil Robichon (Evaluator) is highly engaged but neutral in stance, citing interest in AI-driven tools and cybersecurity.
  • Zycus was expected to deliver spend analytics and IT security documentation to Cecil before an internal review by RTX’s VP and process tools team. As of 2025-09-09, this is overdue.
  • A product demo is pending and must be scheduled urgently to maintain momentum and avoid competitive displacement.
  • No competitive vendors have been identified, but lack of visibility into alternatives is a risk.

2. Market Research Summary (High-Confidence Insights)

  • RTX is focused on margin expansion amid inflation and supply chain disruptions; Zycus’ spend analytics and sourcing tools align with this cost-reduction strategy.
  • RTX is investing in digital transformation to streamline procurement; Zycus’ AI-powered source-to-pay suite directly supports this goal.
  • Supply chain resilience is a top priority; Zycus’ supplier risk and performance management tools can help mitigate disruptions.
  • ESG compliance is increasingly important; Zycus’ supplier management platform can integrate ESG criteria into sourcing decisions.
  • Leadership is committed to leveraging AI and data analytics for operational efficiency, aligning with Zycus’ Merlin platform capabilities.

3. Digital Engagement Summary

  • Top Visited Pages: None (Web traffic = 0)
  • Buyer Intent Keywords: None detected
  • Visit Patterns: No recent digital engagement from RTX on Zycus platforms in the last 30 days

4. Playbook Alignment Analysis

Completed Requirements:

  • Clear business need identified (manual inefficiencies, compliance risk)
  • Key stakeholder (Cecil Robichon) engaged with high involvement
  • Zycus Intake and Merlin Agentic Platform discussed in context of solving pain points
  • Opportunity is in Qualified stage with documented next steps (material delivery, demo)

Pending Steps:

  • No internal milestones or formal progression markers established—risks deal stagnation
  • No multi-threaded relationships beyond Cecil; VP and process tools team not yet directly engaged
  • No demo scheduled; critical for progression to Formal Eval
  • No competitive landscape analysis conducted—potential blind spot
  • No digital engagement or nurturing activities (e.g., webinars, thought leadership)
  • No executive engagement or customer references shared

5. BANT Qualifying Identifiers

  • B (Budget) – Not Qualified
    Rationale: Budget discussions are implied but not confirmed; allocation is contingent on internal review and demo outcomes.
  • A (Authority) – Qualified
    Rationale: Cecil is an evaluator with influence, and the VP and process tools team are involved in the decision-making process.
  • N (Need) – Qualified
    Rationale: Clear pain points with current solution (manual inefficiencies, compliance risk) and interest in AI-driven automation.
  • T (Timeline) – Qualified
    Rationale: Close date is set for 2026-09-30, indicating a 12-month window for vendor selection and implementation.

6. Final Recommendations for Deal Acceleration

Critical Next Steps + Risk Mitigation Plan

  • Deliver spend analytics and IT security documentation to Cecil by 2025-09-10 to avoid further delays.
  • Schedule product demo with VP and process tools team by 2025-09-12. Ensure it is tailored to highlight AI capabilities, compliance support, and automation.
  • Establish internal Zycus milestones to track progress (e.g., material delivery, demo, stakeholder feedback) by 2025-09-13.
  • Initiate competitive landscape analysis by 2025-09-16 to identify potential threats and refine differentiation messaging.
  • Begin multi-threading by identifying and engaging additional stakeholders (e.g., VP, procurement leads) by 2025-09-18.
  • Share relevant thought leadership content and invite RTX stakeholders to Zycus webinars by 2025-09-20 to build trust and engagement.

Best Talking Points for Zycus' Leadership

Key Conversation Focus Areas:

  • How Zycus’ AI-driven spend analytics can eliminate manual reclassification and improve data accuracy
  • Zycus’ ability to support compliance and cost control in regulated industries like aerospace and defense
  • Alignment with RTX’s digital transformation and supply chain resilience goals

Confidence-Building Factors:

  • Emphasize Zycus’ proven track record in aerospace/defense procurement
  • Highlight Merlin’s AI capabilities and cybersecurity compliance
  • Offer customer references from similar industries or transformation journeys

Uncertainties:

  • Budget approval status and funding timeline remain unclear
  • No visibility into potential competitors or incumbent vendor defense
  • Limited engagement beyond Cecil—VP and process tools team need direct interaction

Due Dates Summary (Based on 2025-09-09 to 2026-09-30 Timeline)

  • Deliver documentation to Cecil: 2025-09-10
  • Schedule and conduct demo: by 2025-09-12
  • Establish internal milestones: by 2025-09-13
  • Conduct competitive analysis: by 2025-09-16
  • Begin stakeholder multi-threading: by 2025-09-18
  • Share thought leadership/invite to webinars: by 2025-09-20

By executing these steps with urgency and precision, Zycus can solidify its position as the preferred partner for RTX’s procurement transformation.
Zycus_Differentiation_Why_Zycus__c:
• Proven AI Accuracy – 97–100% automated spend classification, minimizing manual rework.

  • Taxonomy Flexibility – Supports UNSPSC-based and hybrid taxonomies for global consistency.

  • Process Efficiency – Accelerates spend visibility, enabling timely insights for strategic procurement.

  • Robust Cybersecurity – ISO 27001, SOC 1 & SOC 2 certified, US/EU hosting, FedRAMP under consideration.

  • Industry References – Trusted by aerospace & defense leaders like Lockheed Martin, Tata Advanced Systems, with ongoing engagement at Boeing.

  • Domain Expertise – Decades of experience delivering procurement and spend analytics solutions at scale.
ML_Intake_Agentic_Platform_discussed__c: YES, the Zycus Intake and Merlin Agentic Platform were discussed in the context of addressing the frustrations with the current spend analytics solution and the need for a robust, AI-driven tool. There was significant interest from Cecil Robichon, who highlighted the need for a solution that reduces manual reclassification and improves data accuracy. Specific features of the Zycus Merlin platform, such as the AI-driven agents for spend analysis and procurement automation, were likely of interest, although detailed reactions or questions from the participants regarding these features were not explicitly mentioned in the notes.
Trigger_Detail__c: Initial engagement with LinkedIn PPC campaign on 13 August 2025 catalyzed the buyer journey.
